definitions: having sharp points or hooks projecting backward
deliberately hurtful or cutting in manner or speech
examples: The barbed wire fence kept intruders out
The fish hook had a barbed tip
Her barbed comments hurt everyone's feelings
His barbed wit made him unpopular at parties

definitions: without clothing or covering; naked or exposed
only just sufficient; basic and minimal
empty of or lacking in something
examples: His bare feet touched the cold floor
The bare branches showed against the sky
They survived on the bare necessities
She earned a bare living as a waitress
The shelves were bare after the sale
The room looked bare without furniture

definitions: riding a horse without a saddle
examples: She learned to ride bareback as a child
The cowboy rode bareback across the plains

definitions: uncovered or exposed, especially a part of the body
examples: Her bared shoulders gleamed in the sunlight
The dog's bared teeth warned of danger

definitions: wearing nothing on the feet; without shoes or socks
examples: The children ran barefoot on the beach
She walked barefoot across the grass

definitions: relating to the male voice range between tenor and bass
examples: His baritone voice filled the concert hall
The baritone saxophone has a rich tone

definitions: relating to atmospheric pressure as measured by a barometer
examples: Barometric pressure drops before storms arrive
The barometric readings indicated changing weather

definitions: relating to or suitable for a baron or nobility
impressively grand, large, or splendid in style
examples: The baronial estate dated from medieval times
They held baronial titles for generations
The baronial hall could seat hundreds of guests
His baronial mansion impressed all visitors

definitions: relating to the ornate European artistic style of the 17th and 18th centuries
highly ornate and extravagant in style; excessively decorated
examples: The baroque church featured elaborate gold decoration
Bach composed during the baroque period
Her baroque writing style confused many readers
The baroque details overwhelmed the simple design

definitions: marked with bars or stripes; having bars across
prohibited or excluded from entering or participating
examples: The barred window prevented escape
A barred owl has striped feathers
He was barred from the casino for cheating
The barred door kept everyone out
